Package ClientSideTests

Class TestOrders

java.lang.Object
ClientSideTests.TestOrders
public class TestOrders
extends java.lang.Object
The following tests are used to test the functionality of the Orders class. The key functionality that will be tested is placing a buy and sell order. As part of this this class will test that an exception is thrown in the following scenarios: - Buy order exceeds organisations total credits minus the cost of unconsolidated buy orders. - Sell order exceeds the amount of an asset the organisation holds. - Sell order for an asset the organisation does not hold. - Asset being traded does not exist in the system. - Trades are reconciled if there is another trade that satisfies the reconciliation requirements
Author:
Alistair Ridge

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TestOrders()
    Create the test assets and test units used for the tests.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void cleanup()
    Ensure that the orders table does not contain any outstanding orders that may affect the tests.
    void testAddOrder()
    Test that orders are correctly added to the database.
    void TestAssetDoesNotExist()
    Test to check that an exception is thrown if the specified asset either does not exist in the units assets or in assets used in the application.
    void TestBuyTooExpensive()
    Test that when the total cost of a buy order exceeds the organisations credits an exception is thrown
    void TestBuyTooMany()
    Test that when the amount of assets being sold exceeds the quantity held by an organisation an exception is thrown.
    void TestConsolidate()
    Test that upon consolidation of a trade the orders table is emptied.
    void TestDelete()
    Test that upon deletion of trade it no longer exists in the database.
    void TestOrdersSetup()
    Test that orders are created correctly
    void TestSellTooMany()
    Test that when too many assets are attempted to be sold an exception is thrown.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • TestOrders

      public TestOrders() throws AlreadyExists, IllegalString, InvalidAmount
      Create the test assets and test units used for the tests.
      Throws:
      AlreadyExists - Throw an exception if the asset or unit already exists
      IllegalString - Throws an exception if the unit name is not a valid string
      InvalidAmount - Throw an exception if the unit balance is not a valid amount

  • Method Details

    • cleanup

      @BeforeEach public void cleanup() throws AlreadyExists, IllegalString
      Ensure that the orders table does not contain any outstanding orders that may affect the tests. Ensur that users are setup correctly for the tests.
      Throws:
      AlreadyExists - Throw an exception if the user already exists
      IllegalString - Throw an exception if the password is not a valid string

    • TestOrdersSetup

      @Test public void TestOrdersSetup()
      Test that orders are created correctly

    • testAddOrder

      @Test public void testAddOrder() throws DoesNotExist, OrderException
      Test that orders are correctly added to the database.
      Throws:
      DoesNotExist - Throw an exception if the order details do not exist (e.g. unit or asset)
      OrderException - Throw an exception if there is an issue with the order

    • TestSellTooMany

      @Test public void TestSellTooMany()

    • TestConsolidate

      @Test public void TestConsolidate() throws DoesNotExist, OrderException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Test that upon consolidation of a trade the orders table is emptied.
      Throws:
      DoesNotExist - Throw an exception if the order details do not exist (e.g. unit or asset)
      OrderException - Throw an exception if there is an issue with the order
      java.lang.InterruptedException - Throw exception if the is an issue with the timer

    • TestDelete

      @Test public void TestDelete() throws DoesNotExist, OrderException
      Test that upon deletion of trade it no longer exists in the database.
      Throws:
      DoesNotExist - Throw an exception if the order details do not exist (e.g. unit or asset)
      OrderException - Throw an exception if there is an issue with the order
